description: Kubernetes, also known as K8s, is an open source system for automating deployment, scaling, and management of containerized applications.

root.name: annotate
tip: Update the annotations on a resource

root.name: api-resources
tip: Print the supported API resources on the server

root.name: api-versions
tip: Print the supported API versions on the server, in the form of "group/version"

root.name: apply
tip: Apply a configuration to a resource by file name or stdin

root.name: attach
tip: Attach to a running container

root.name: auth
tip: Inspect authorization

root.name: autoscale
tip: Auto-scale a deployment, replica set, stateful set, or replication controller

root.name: certificate
tip: Modify certificate resources

root.name: cluster-info
tip: Display cluster information

root.name: completion
tip: Output shell completion code for the specified shell (bash, zsh, fish, or powershell)

root.name: config
tip: Modify kubeconfig files

root.name: cordon
tip: Mark node as unschedulable
E: cordon foo   --- Mark node "foo" as unschedulable

root.name: cp
tip: Copy files and directories to and from containers

root.name: create
tip: Create a resource from a file or from stdin
JSON and YAML formats are accepted.
E: create -f ./pod.json                    --- Create a pod using the data in pod.json
create -f registry.yaml --edit -o json  --- Edit the data in registry.yaml in JSON then create the resource using the edited data

root.name: debug
tip: Create debugging sessions for troubleshooting workloads and nodes

root.name: delete
tip: Delete resources by file names, stdin, resources and names, or by resources and label selector

root.name: describe
tip: Show details of a specific resource or group of resources

root.name: diff
tip: Diff the live version against a would-be applied version

root.name: drain
tip: Drain node in preparation for maintenance

root.name: edit
tip: Edit a resource on the server

root.name: events
tip: List events

root.name: exec
tip: Execute a command in a container

root.name: explain
tip: Get documentation for a resource

root.name: expose
tip: Take a replication controller, service, deployment or pod and expose it as a new Kubernetes service

root.name: get
tip: Display one or many resources

root.name: kustomize
tip: Build a kustomization target from a directory or URL

root.name: label
tip: Update the labels on a resource

root.name: logs
tip: Print the logs for a container in a pod

root.name: options
tip: List some options can be passed to any command

root.name: patch
tip: Update fields of a resource

root.name: plugin
tip: Provides utilities for interacting with plugins

root.name: port-forward
tip: Forward one or more local ports to a pod

root.name: proxy
tip: Run a proxy to the Kubernetes API server

root.name: replace
tip: Replace a resource by file name or stdin

root.name: rollout
tip: Manage the rollout of a resource

root.name: run
tip: Run a particular image on the cluster

root.name: scale
tip: Set a new size for a deployment, replica set, or replication controller

root.name: set
tip: Set specific features on objects

root.name: taint
tip: Update the taints on one or more nodes

root.name: top
tip: Display resource (CPU/memory) usage

root.name: uncordon
tip: Mark node as schedulable
E: uncordon foo   --- Mark node "foo" as schedulable

root.name: version
tip: Print the client and server version information

root.name: wait
tip: Experimental: Wait for a specific condition on one or many resources

options.name: --version
tip: Show the version.

common_options.name: --help
tip: Show the help.
